{{Infobox |Box title = Alphanso Adams |image = File:Adams face.png|278)px ] ] |caption = |Row 1 title = Gender |Row 1 info = Male |Row 2 title = Faction |Row 2 info = U.S. Army, Delta Force |Row 3 title = Status |Row 3 info = Unknown (most likely K.I.A) |Row 4 title = Appears in |Row 4 info = ''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]'' |Row 5 title = Period |Row 5 info = 21st Century|Row 6 title = Rank |Row 6 info = 1st Lieutenant|Row 7 title = Voiced by |Row 7 info = Christopher Reid}}
{{Template:Quote|Only thing that matters are the words 'Mission Accomplished.' The sooner I hear those words, the sooner I can go home and get back to being me.|Adams.}}
1st Lieutenant '''Alphanso Adams''' is the secondary protagonist of ''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]'' and a member of [[Captain Martin Walker|Walker's]] squad. He is the squad's heavy gunner and is equipped with an [[M249 SAW]] and an [[M1014]] combat shotgun. Out of combat, he is used as the team's breacher and tracker.
Throughout most of the game, Adams remains loyal to Walker and follows all of his orders. During the final assault on the [[33rd Infantry|33rd]], however, he begins to show disgust for Walker and only cares about killing, due to [[Lugo]]'s death and blames it on Walker, saying "Lugo's blood is on your hands, not mine. Bang"
On the final assault on the [[33rd Infantry|33rd]], Walker attempts to surrender to gain access inside the tower, but an enraged Adams insists on fighting to the death and shames Walker into running for safety inside the tower. Adams fights the remaining 33rd Infantry and isn't seen again after that. It is most likely he is dead, as he is neither rescued nor said to have survived the stand off.
==Gameplay==
Both of Walker's companions have ability when ordered to attack a particular target. Adams' ability is to throw grenades and supress targeets, if his target isn't killed with gunfire from his M249 SAW. This is extremely useful on harder difficulties where turrets and entrenched enemies target Walker over his companions. Hold the order button to make the reticle appear, pick your target, and Adams will surpress and kill the target with his M249 or throw a grenade at the target depending if they are entrenched, taking cover, or in the wide open.
==Trivia== *Adams is an experienced pilot, as shown in the first mission. *Adams sides with Captain Walker more often than [[Lugo]]. *During parts of the game where the enemy doesn't know the squad is there, he will use a supressed M9 to kill the enemies the player targets. *Adams has a scar on his left eyebrow. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line characters]] [[Category:Delta Force]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Spec Ops]] [[Category:Freindlies in Spec Ops: The Line]]
{{w:JAlbor}}

page.title: User blog comment:KillHil/Spec Ops: The Line Stands Apart from Call of Duty/@comment-67.247.209.126-20120521104839

revision.comment: Created page with "I coulnd't have said it better myself. The city feels linear, but there is comfort in it, no confusion as to whats happening. First New York is under attack, then England is chem..."
revision.text:
I coulnd't have said it better myself. The city feels linear, but there is comfort in it, no confusion as to whats happening. First New York is under attack, then England is chemically attacked, then germany and france are overwhelmed. You tend to lose track of where the action really is. This doesn't have that problem. And that it being based off the book Heart of Darkness, and occuring in what looks to be a prospering world, Dubai looks post apocolyptic, resembling something of Mad Max, where your not living your boring monotonous life, everydays is a fight for survival against the elements and people who want you dead. Heros turned villians, and villains turned something unspeakable through action.
Very well put. Pre-order is in.
-Be easy.

[[Category:Videos]]Category: Games
Keywords: xbox 360, games, spec ops the line, ign, IGNEntertainment, Gaming, Game, Gamers, Video Games, Gameplay, HD, Official, 2012, Video Game, Entertainment, ps3, pc, Multiplayer, Bonuses, Pre-order, Special, trailer, PlayStation 3

[[File:Officer.jpg|thumb|One of The Exile's Officers]]The Officer class is an offensive-minded support class that can alter the flow of a battle before firing a single round. Officers and nearby teammates benefit from a significant damage reduction. Officers also gain a 50% boost to other class abilities that they are within range of. For example, an Officer standing near a Medic and Gunner inflicts 30% greater damage and enjoy 30% faster health regen, a opposed to the normal 20% bonuses.
What truly sets the Officer apart is his ability to call in a supply drop. Any teammate who enters the glowing supply drop area has their ammo and grenade supply filled. Similarly, the Officer can also place an objective on the map. Teammates that stand within 10 meters of the objective gain favorable damage increases/reductions.
Officers need to be a part of the action, but not necessarily the tip of the spear. Hang back perhaps to defend a Medic and deploy supply drops and issue objectives to grant damage bonuses to your Gunner or Breacher. Its important to not take unnecessary risks as an Officer, as the entire team stands to suffer if you do. A skilled Officer can be particularly beneficial in games of Mutiny and Attrition. ==Head Kits== : The Exiles *[FUBAR]Warzone *Delta *Thrifty *The Man *Zipper : The Damned *[FUBAR] Morgue *Round Up *Hoedown *Birding *Frenzy ==Accesories== : The Exiles *[FUBAR] Task *Commander *Communications *Trailblazer *Survivor : The Damned *[FUBAR] Radio *Rally *Sergeant *Extended *Prepared ==Abilites== : Normal *20% incoming damage reduction for self and teammates within 10m. *Increases effectiveness of other class abilities by 50%. *Place an objective that lasts 60s. Anyone on your faction within 10m of objective get 10% damage increase and 10% damage reduction. : Re-Enlist *40% incoming damage reduction for self and teammates within 15m. *Increases effectiveness of other class abilities by 75%. *Supply drop cool down timer reduced to 30s. *Any visible enemies within 10m of Officer appear on minimap for all teammates. ==Trivia== *The voice actors for this class are Daniel Hugh Kelly & John Cygan. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line class]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

[[File:The_damned.jpg|frame|The Damned]] '''The Damned''' are a multiplayer faction in ''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]''. They are composed of soldiers of the [[33rd Infantry]] Regiment that stayed loyal to [[Colonel John Konrad|Colonel Konrad]] during the crisis in [[Dubai]]. They have an overall "psychotic" appearance, as opposed to [[The Exiles]], who have a more professional, militaristic look.
The Damned have access to the [[Scavenger]] class, which is better at repairing Vital Points, take less explosive damage, and their explosives have an increased radius. ==Gameplay== The Damned enjoy faction bonuses that aid them in ways that allow for a slightly more covert approach to combat. For starters, they benefit from a slight increase in weapon range effectiveness. This bonus gives just enough of an edge to their Snipers and those in long-range standoffs to tilt the balance in their favor, assuming all else is equal. The Damned gain a small XP bonus for kills made while in the sandstorm. This, combined with their reduction to falling damage, makes it tempting to risk the howling winds of the sandstorm, especially with the Adapted perk equipped. Of course, falling off a bridge at Crows Nest is still fatalsome heights are just too great to survive. Whereas the Exiles are encouraged to carry a pistol as a secondary weapon, those playing as an Exile may want to consider equipping a sniper rifle alongside their standard assault rifle or shotgun even when not playing as a Sniper so as to take advantage of the slight increase in weapon range effectiveness. ==Kits== *Patient 0 *Sick *The Guide *Socket Wrench *Fancy Sick *Tracker *Cow-Poke *Miami Style *Sickness *Vigilante *Walrus ==Abilites== *10% XP bonus for sandstorm kills. *5% increase in weapon range effectiveness. *70% damage reduction to falling damage.
==Trivia==
*The Damned look extremely different from how the are shown in the single-player campaign. *From the 33rd seen in single-player, The Damned won the war against The Exiles. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Spec Ops]] [[Category:Faction]] [[Category:America]] [[Category:33rd Infantry]]

[[File:The_Exiles.jpg|frame|The Exiles]]'''The Exiles''' are a multiplayer faction in ''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]''. They are composed of soldiers of the [[33rd Infantry]] Regiment that rebelled against [[Colonel John Konrad|Colonel Konrad]]'s orders during the crisis in [[Dubai]]. They have an overall more professional look than [[The Damned]], which have a more rag-tag appearance. The Exiles have access to the [[Breacher]] class, which deals more damage with explosives and can carry double the amount of them. ==Gameplay== The Exiles faction bonuses aid them in moving quickly across the map and close-range combat. The damage reduction offered while on zip-lines and fast ropes is particularly useful on maps like Crows Nest and Extinction that feature numerous zip-lines.
The 10% damage bonus for pistol usage is helpfulespecially for those who have unlocked the Desert Eagle or .44 Magnumand in the right hands can be enough of an advantage to forego equipping the Always Prepared perk. Lastly, the XP bonus for melee kills comes in handy for those who like to hunt from the shadows and for heavily armored Breachers who can get in close to their enemy. This bonus makes it certainly worth downing your enemy with non-fatal shots and moving in for the execution. ==Abilites== *15% XP bonus for melee kills. *10% damage bonus for pistols. *70% damage reduction while on zip-lines and fast ropes. ==Kits== *Combat *Thief *Bloodshot *Shades *Flying Skull *Razor Mouth *Mosca Amarilia *Anonymus *Krazy Katana *Boned ==Trivia== *From the single player perspective The Exiles loss to The Damned or left Dubai on their own. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Spec Ops]] [[Category:Faction]] [[Category:America]] [[Category:33rd Infantry]]

{{Infobox |Box title = 33rd Infantry Battalion |image = File:33rd.png |caption = Members of the 33rd torturing a citizen of Dubai. |Row 1 title = Appears in |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Affiliation |Row 2 info = US Army (Formerly)|Row 3 title = Interactions |Row 3 info = Hostile |Row 4 title = Leaders |Row 4 info = [[Colonel John Konrad]] (Formerly)
[[Radioman]]}}
{{Template:Quote|It's clear the 33rd is no longer acting as part of the US Army.|[[Captain Martin Walker]]}}
The '''33rd Infantry''' is a regiment of the US Army that was led by [[Colonel John Konrad]]. The 33rd took part in the conflict in [[Dubai]]. While the main US Forces in Dubai were being pulled out, Konrad and the 33rd stayed and tried to help the evacuation.
The first attempt at evacuation, led by Konrad himself, failed drastically, resulting in over 1,300 dead civilians. Men in the regiment, seeing no hope in Konrad, rebelled against the 33rd and split up into a group called "[[The Exiles]]". ==Singleplayer== The 33rd battalion, on their way out of Afghanistan, was volunteered by Colonel Konrad (whose motives weren't entirely noble) to assist in the evacuation of Dubai. However, when they received the order to abandon the city before all the civillians were evacuated, Konrad and the 33rd disobeyed orders and remained to assist the remaining citizens. But when the storm wall hit Dubai, the city was devastated, and evacuation became virtually impossible.
The local population panicked, causing the 33rd, now the de facto government, to institute martial law. But the battalion was not able to keep contol without enforcing increasingly harsh control.
Months later, as the storm continued to surround the city, Konrad and the 33rd attempted to lead a convoy out of Dubai by road. The evacuation failed horribly, resulting in the loss of 1,300 civillians and many soldiers. After this failed attempt, many of the 33rd, including Konrad's command staff, rebelled against Konrad, becoming "The Exiles". Konrad responded by executing the mutineers and displaying their bodies. By this time, a local insurgency had sprung up, but the 33rd was able to force them into a ceasefire.
At some point afterwords, Konrad recorded and broadcasted a message of his failure through the storm wall, and then committed suicide.
In the campaign, Captain [[Martin Walker|Walker]] and his men are tasked with finding survivors in the city of Dubai after the signal from [[Colonel John Konrad]] is picked up by the U.S. Army.
When the 33rd is first encountered by Walker, insurgents (later found out to be lead by [[CIA]] team [[Grey Fox]]) have broken the ceasefire and taken a infantryman captive for interrogation. Upon finding the soldier, he warns the other 33rd that Delta Force has arrived (On the first time they mistaken them for CIA). The 33rd Infantry immediately become hostile, hunting down Captain Walker and his men throughout the game.
When Walker reaches the tower at the end of the game, he has a hallucination of the final members of the 33rd surrendering Dubai to him. In reality, he has completely eradicated the 33rd and all of its members. It is unclear who was leading the 33rd, as Konrad had already killed himself and executed his command team.
By the time Walker encounters the 33rd, the battalion has seen an extreme degridation of military discipline. Soldiers regularly commit atrocities (in the belief that it is neccessary), dress in non-regulation or scavenged attire, and have killed many of their own men, hanging their corpses above roads and above their outposts. However, as Walker discovers, they still have some humanity. For example, the civillians being rounded up by the 33rd at The Nest were actually being taken to 33rd controlled territory to keep them safe from the fighting. In addition a list of almost a full company's worth of names and dog tags are on the wall with pictures and candles in a bunker near Konrad's tower. Also behind the atrocities committed, 33rd were actually trying to "keep people alive" by trying to foil the CIA's plan to cripple Dubai's main water supply.
==Multiplayer== In multiplayer, the 33rd infantry appear as one of the playable factions. They are simply referred to as [[The Damned]]. ==Known Members== *[[Colonel John Konrad|Konrad]] (K.I.A.) *[[Radioman]] (K.I.A.) *[[Lieutenant Bradley|Bradley]] (K.I.A.) *Benson (Unknown) *Lieutenant John McPherson (K.I.A.) *[[Sergeant Forbes|Staff Sergeant Forbes]] (Unknown) *Martzen (K.I.A.) *Private First Class Pete Gobbi (Unknown) *Crosby (Unknown) *Pineda (K.I.A.)
==Known Equipment== As a U.S. Stryker battalion, the 33rd had access to standard military equipment. But because they were stranded in a hostile environment for so long, some of this equipment was lost, forcing them to scavenge for additional firearms. Most soldiers where standard ACUs, with the notable exception of Zulu squad, but they wear varying equipment. Only some of the soldiers still wear ACH/MICH-2000s, even during combat. The other soldiers wear shemaghs, boonie hats, patrol caps, balacalva, or nothing at all. Some have sunglasses and/or camo face paint. [[Zulu Squad|Zulu squad]] has customized their uniforms even more, wearing DAPS plate carriers and painting their uniforms black and white with skulls on their faces. Many, if not most, of the battalion's vehicles had been lost either to hostile fire, being buried in sand, lack of fuel, or lack of practical use in the unstable, sandy environment.
*[[M4A1]] *[[M249 SAW]] *[[SCAR-H]] *[[UMP 45|UMP-45]] *[[AK47|AK-47]] *[[M9]] *[[Scout Tactical]] *[[Scout Helicopter]] *[[UH-60 Blackhawk]] *[[W1300]] *[[FAMAS]] *[[AA-12]] *[[417]] *[[P90]] *[[M1014]] *[[HMMWV]] *[[Stryker]] *[[M120 Mortar]]
==Trivia== *The 33rd is most likely an infantry battalion of a Stryker brigade combat team (BCT). This Stryker BCTs are the only units in the U.S. Army currently using the IAV Stryker vehicle. The fact that several Strykers and few specialized units are seen suggests that the 33rd is indeed a Stryker company. *The 33rd has a significant number of helicopters. Though infantry battalions do not include aerial units, helicopters from the parent division can attach helicopters for certain operations. *In real life, there is no unit known as the 33rd battalion in the US army currently. However, because the 33rd uses Strykers, it is likely supposed to be a part of either the 2nd or 25th Infantry divisions as they are the only ones that currently have Stryker BCTs deployed in Afghanistan, which is where the 33rd was stationed before going to Dubai. *The 33rd could have possibly been a part of USOCOM as they have equipment only SOCOM uses.
==Gallery== <gallery captionalign="left"> Dead 33rd.png|Corpses of 33rd soldiers. Dead 33rd.jpg|Adams by a dead 33rd soldier Running 33rd.jpg|33rd soldiers running 33rd Shirt.jpg|The 33rd Infantry pre-order t-shirt spec-ops-the-line-20111121021324388-3562930.jpg|Members of Konrad's command staff that tried to rebel against him. spec-ops-the-line-20111121021329967-3562934.jpg|More members of the 33rd that tried to rebel against Konrad. spec-ops-the-line-20111121021328640-3562933.jpg|What appears to be a memorial of the 33rd (Though there are enough names to comprise the entire battalion). spec-ops-the-line-20120206000352840-3597773.jpg|Walker watches as members of the 33rd torture civilians to extract information from CIA agent Gould. Untitled4.png|The 33rd rounding up civilians from the nest to take them away from the fighting. Delta mistakenly believes that they intend to kill the civilians, an assumption not helped by the Radioman's broadcasts. Untitled5.png|33rd soldier typically wear ACU fatigues and MOLLE modular vests/plate carriers. Untitled7.png|Delta's intervention helped agent Gould turn the 33rd's trap against itself. Untitled17.png Untitled20.png Untitled24.png|The Gate being guarded by the 33rd. Untitled31.png|Mortally wounded by Delta's white phosphorous, a 33rd soldier reveals that they were helping the civilians, and that delta actually massacred them. Untitled39.png|33rd soldier wearing a MICH 2000/ACH. Untitled40.png|33rd Sergeant Forbes surrendering to Delta. Untitled43.png|Sergeant Forbes warns Walker that evacuation isn't possible. And that Konrad was trying to save lives. Untitled47.png|33rd's Zulu squad members deploying from a [[UH-60 Blackhawk]]. Untitled53.png|Walker hallucinates that the final members of the Damned 33rd surrender to him. Untitled54.png|Zulu squad soldier. </gallery> [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Faction]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line characters]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line enemy]] [[Category:33rd Infantry]] [[Category:America]]

{{Infobox |Box title = FAMAS |Row 1 title = Appears in |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Type |Row 2 info = Assault Rifle|image = Image:The_Line_Famas.jpg |Row 3 title = Used by |Row 3 info = [[33rd Infantry]] |Row 4 title = Magazine size |Row 4 info = 25|Row 5 title = Special ability |Row 5 info = Scope}} The '''FAMAS''' is an assault rifle that appears in [[Spec Ops: The Line]].
In the campaign, it comes with the ability to toggle between automatic and burst fire. It also has a scope, which is ideal for picking off targets at a longer range.
In multiplayer, the FAMAS retains its scope from the campaign but only fires in fully automatic mode. It has a high rate of fire, and is the only assault rifle in multiplayer to have a scope, making it useful for long-range engagements. However, it does not have any crosshairs, making close quarters engagements difficult. ==Trivia== *The FAMAS is the only weapon to pass over its ability in the campaign over to multiplayer.
<gallery captionalign="left"> Sights.jpg|Aiming down the FAMAS scope. </gallery> [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Weapons of Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Assault Rifles]]

[[File:SOTLSniper.jpg|thumb|366px|A sniper using his Ghillie suit's ability.]] Sniping plays a critical role in Spec Ops: The Line on all but a couple of maps. Snipers benefit from substantially increased accuracy, a bonus that spreads to nearby teammates as well. Its best to consider this an accidental benefit, as snipers tend to be most effective when lurking in the shadows, alone. That said, it can pay to have a nearby Gunner or Officer serving either as a bodyguard or distraction.
The snipers two other unique traits are perhaps the most important to the team. snipers can mark an enemy by using their rifles scope to tag the enemy. Assuming the sniper doesnt kill the target right away, the enemy becomes visible on the minimap for 60 seconds. Finally, snipers wear a special one-of-a-kind Ghillie suit that allows the wearer to appear invisible after remaining motionless for 4 seconds. Any motion at alleven to shoulder the rifle and aimbreaks the effect. This benefit is particularly useful after reenlistment.
To achieve the greatest success as a sniper, seek out hiding places along the perimeter of the map that offer a concealed view of the battlefield. Good sniping positions are typically dark, elevated, and feature plenty of cover that the sniper can hide behind. Once reenlisted, make sure to have a sniper on hand to defend or attack enemy Com Stations in Uplink matches. ==Abilites== : Normal *20% accuracy increase for self and teammates within 15m. *Mark an enemy by aiming at them using a scoped weapon. Marked enemies appear on teammates minimap for 60s. *Become invisible by remaining still for 4s. Moving or firing breaks the illusion. : Re-Enlist *30% accuracy increase for self and teammates within 30m. *Wont appear on minimap when shooting with sniper rifles. *Hack and repair Com Stations 30% faster. *Faster invisibility with ability to aim and rotate. ==Head Kits== : The Exiles *[FUBAR] Skunk *Hood Rat *Nomad *Dusk *Infared : The Damned *[FUBAR] Specter *Incog *Strapped *Diesel *Puck You ==Accesories== : The Exiles *[FUBAR] Scope *Stealth *Range *Escalation *Marksman : The Damned *[FUBAR] Tracker *Assasin *Sharpshooter *Covert *Predator ==Trivia== *The lasers coming from sniper's weapons may be rangefinders. *In The Line's multiplayer the Sniper class only has 1 choice of armour called "Ghille Suit". [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Covert Assault]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Stealth Patrol]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Airborne Commando]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Ranger Elite]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line class]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Rangers Lead the Way]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Ranger Team Bravo]] [[Category:Spec Ops II: Green Berets]]

{{Infobox |Box title = Robert Darden |image = File:Radio dj.jpg |Row 1 title = Gender |Row 1 info = Male |Row 2 title = Faction |Row 2 info = [[33rd Infantry]] |Row 3 title = Status |Row 3 info = Deceased |Row 4 title = Appears in |Row 4 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 5 title = Period |Row 5 info = 21st Century|Row 6 title = Voiced by |Row 6 info = Jake Busey}}
''{{Template:Quote|I know there's a lot of you asking the same question right now: why? There was no reason for any of this.|The Radio DJ during a broadcast.}}''
The '''Radioman''' (real name '''Robert Darden''') is a character and secondary antagonist in [[Spec Ops: The Line]].
According to [[Martin Walker|Walker]], the Radioman was a reporter with the [[33rd Infantry]] and was apparently "the person you didn't want loose in a firefight", causing [[Colonel John Konrad|Konrad]] to trust him. In an intel grab before meeting him, it is revealed his name is Robert Darden, and he worked for Rolling Stone magazine. He was shot by Lugo 3 times with an M9 pistol, because Lugo thought it was necessary, considering "he kept the 33rd on our asses."- Lugo ==Quotes== {{Template:Quote|What are the 8 scariest words in the dictionary? "We're Delta Force and we're here to help you."|The Radio DJ during a broadcast.}} [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line characters]] [[Category:33rd Infantry]]

[[File:Gunner.jpg|thumb|217px]] The Gunner is your basic Footsoldier who excels in close to medium-range combat. Capable of carrying a heavy weapon as a secondary weapon, this frees users from having to dedicate a slot to the Always Prepared perk.
Gunners take 20% less damage from enemy attacks, making them capable of striking out alone in Chaos matches or playing defense in Uplink or Buried. Gunners also benefit from a 20% damage increase, a benefit they share with nearby teammates. This damage increase can be particularly beneficial when paired alongside an Officer or Breacher when going after an enemy Vital Point in Buried matches.
The Exiles pistol damage bonus isnt likely to factor in when playing as a Gunner, given the classs ability to equip a heavy weapon instead of a pistol for backup. ==Head Kits== : The Exiles *[FUBAR] Gassed *Gearhead *Glory Hound : The Damned *[FUBAR] Airlift *Grounded *Jet Set ==Accesories== : The Exiles *[FUBAR] Artillery *Trail *Soldier *Munitions *Bandolier *Mission : The Damned *[FUBAR] Ammo *Mission *Iron *Cannoneer *Assault *Frontline ==Abilites== : Normal *20% damage increase for self and teammates within 15m. *Gunner takes 20% less damage. *Replace sidearm with a heavy weapon. : Re-Enlist *40% damage increase for self and teammates within 30m. *Gunner takes 40% less damage. *Replace sidearm and primary gun heavy weapons. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line class]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

[[File:The_Line_Medic.jpg|thumb|206px]] The Medic serves an important role, but is not for everyone. The Medic is best for players who embrace teamwork, communicate well, and dont mind playing more of a support role. All teams, particularly in Mutiny and Attrition matches, should have a Medic amongst their ranks.
The Medic increases the health regeneration rate of all nearby teammates. Medic players can also manually inject a shot of adrenaline to a teammate, thereby giving him 5 seconds of protection from general damage other than headshots and explosives. Try to administer this adrenaline boost to teammates as they capture a Rally Point or Control Point in games of Uplink.
Lastly, the Medic can quickly heal teammates in DBNO and send them back into the fray with 5 seconds of invincibility. The best Medics tend to hang back behind cover but maintain contact with their teammates so as to provide the health regen bonus. ==Abilites== : Normal *20% increase in self and teammate health regen rate within 15m. *Heal DBNO teammates 45% faster and give 5s invincibility. *Give teammates a 5s adrenaline boost where only headshots and explosives affect them. : Re-Enlist *40% increase in self and teammate health regen rate within 30m. *Heal DBNO teammates 90% faster and give 10s invincibility. *Adrenaline boost now lasts 10s. *Revive dead allies as long as they havent respawned. ==Head Kits== : The Exiles *[FUBAR] Surgeon General *Malpractice *Ace *Mummy : The Damned *[FUBAR] Iveler *0 Negative *Toxic *Fired Up ==Accesories== : The Exiles *[FUBAR] Trauma *Triage *Tourniquent *Emergancy *Field : The Damned *[FUBAR] Surgeon *First Aid *Patck *Precrption *Support [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line class]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

[[File:Delta_Force.png|thumb]] '''1st Special Forces Operational Detachment-Delta''' ('''1st SFOD-D''') is one of the United States' secretive tier one counter-terrorism and Special Mission Units.''' '''
==''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]''== Delta Force makes its first appearance in the series in ''Spec Ops: The Line''.
Captain [[Martin Walker]] and[[Adams| his ]][[Lugo|squad]] are Delta Force operators. His squad is tasked with finding [[Colonel John Konrad]] in the deserted city of Dubai. ==Known Members== *Captain [[Martin Walker]] *Staff Sergeant [[John Lugo]] *1st Lieutenant [[Alphanso Adams]]
==Known Equipment== *[[M249 SAW]] *[[M4A1]] *[[M9]] *[[Scout Tactical]] *[[M1014]] *[[TAR-21]] ==Trivia== *The M4A1 and M249 SAW were both retired by SFOD-D after the [[wikipedia:Heckler & Koch HK416|Heckler & Koch HK416]] and Mk 40 were created but Walker and Adams still used the retired weapons.
==Gallery== <gallery captionalign="left"> Delta Team.jpg|Walker's Delta team Intro.jpg|Adams, Walker, and Lugo, from closest to farthest. </gallery> [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Delta Force]] [[Category:Faction]] [[Category:Spec Ops]] [[Category:America]] [[Category:Freindlies in Spec Ops: The Line]]

[[File:US_Army_Special_Forces.png|thumb]] The '''United States Army Special Forces,''' also known as the '''Green Berets''' because of their distinctive service headgear, are a special operations force tasked with five primary missions: unconventional warfare (the original and most important mission of Special Forces), foreign internal defense, special reconnaissance, direct action, special reconnaissance, direct action , and counter-terrorism. The first two emphasize language, cultural, and training skills in working with foreign troops. ==Spec Ops: Green Berets== The first and so far only time the Green Berets appear is in the game ''[[Spec Ops II: Green Berets|Spec Ops: Green Berets]]''. [[Category:Spec Ops II: Green Berets]] [[Category:Spec Ops]] [[Category:Faction]] [[Category:America]]

page.title: File:75 Ranger Regiment Coat Of Arms.png

revision.text: [[File:75_Ranger_Regiment_Coat_Of_Arms.png|thumb]] The '''75th Ranger Regiment''' (Airborne), also known as '''Rangers''', is a Special Operations light infantry elite unit of the United States Army. It operates as a special operations force of the United States Army Special Operations Command (USASOC). There motto is "Rangers Lead the Way!". ==In the series== The US Army Rangers have appeard in almost every game and most of the games' titles are their namesake. The Rangers are always sent into missions with two-men squads. [[Spec Ops II: Green Berets]] and [[Spec Ops: The Line|The Line]] are the only games where they do not appear, being replaced by the titular [[US Army Green Berets|Green Beret]]s and the [[Delta Force]], respectively. ==Known Equipment== *[[M249 SAW]] *M16 *M60 *Grenades *Ithaca 37 *HKMP55D *M203 *BARRET M82A *SSG *M4 *HKG11 *[[AK47|AK-74]] *[[Laptop]] *RPK *G11 *HK5SSD *[[AH-6J Little Bird|AH-6 Little Bird]] *RPK ==Known Members== *O'Conner *King *Martinez *Baldwin *Merrill *Griffbaski [[Category:Spec Ops: Stealth Patrol]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Airborne Commando]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Ranger Elite]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Rangers Lead the Way]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Covert Assault]] [[Category:Spec Ops:Ranger Team Bravo]] [[Category:Spec Ops]] [[Category:Faction]] [[Category:America]]

{{Infobox |Box title = M-590 |image = Image:Moss. 590.jpg |caption = The 590 in the hands of an enemy |Row 1 title = Appears In |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Type |Row 2 info = Shotgun |Row 3 title = Capacity}}The '''M-590''' is a shotgun that appears in ''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]''. It is only available in multiplayer. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Weapons of Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Shotguns]]

{{Infobox |Box title = RPG-7 |image = File:SOTLrpg7.jpg |caption = [[Captain Walker|Walker]] firing an RPG-7 at a Black Hawk helicopter. |Row 1 title = Appears in |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Type |Row 2 info = Grenade Launcher |Row 3 title = Magazine size |Row 3 info = 1 |Row 4 title = Used by |Row 4 info = Refugees}} The '''RPG-7''' is a launcher that appears in [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Weapons of Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Launcher]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

{{Infobox |Box title = M32 MGL |image = File:SpecOps MGL Mk 1L.jpg |Row 1 title = Appears in |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Type |Row 2 info = Grenade Launcher|Row 3 title = Magazine size |Row 3 info = 6 |Row 4 title = Used by |Row 4 info = [[33rd Infantry]]}}The '''M32 MGL''' is a launcher that appears ''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]''. In singleplayer, the M32 MGL first appears when [[Martin Walker]] is given one by [[Agent Riggs]] and uses it to defend the water trucks that Riggs is stealing. In [[Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer|multiplayer]] it can only be used by the [[Gunner]] class as their secondary weapon and is the final unlock for multiplayer. ==Trivia== *In the [[FUBAR Pack ]]commercial an [[The Exiles|Exiles]] [[Officer]] is seen using the M32 MGL, but in game only the Gunner can use it. [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Weapons of Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Launcher]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

{{Infobox |Box title = MK 13 |image = File:MK 13.jpg |caption = The MK 13 attached to a [[SCAR-H]] in the hands of a member of the [[33rd Infantry|33rd]]. |Row 1 title = Appears in |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Type |Row 2 info = Grenade Launcher |Row 3 title = Magazine size |Row 3 info = 1}}The '''MK 13''' is a underslung grenade launcher that appears in [[Spec Ops: The Line]] and is attached to the [[SCAR-H]], but it is only avaliable in the singleplayer. [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Weapons of Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Launcher]]

revision.text:
[[File:Breacher.jpg|thumb|259px|right]] Unique to the Exiles, the Breacher is an explosives expert that helps you get the biggest bang from your grenades and rockets. The Breacher can carry up to eight grenades or C4, each of which pack a 10% larger blast radius.
The Breacher really comes into his own in Buried matches, provided youve reenlisted. Not only can you carry triple the capacity of grenades and C4, but youll be able to inflict greater damage to Vital Points and the enemy HVT. The Breachers increased explosive radius also benefits nearby teammates. The actual grenade or C4 neednt detonate within twenty meters of the Breacher. Rather, any C4 or grenade deployed by a nearby teammate will experience the increased radius, even Proximity Mines placed clear across the map.
The Breacher is similar to the Gunner in that it doesnt require any extra teamwork and can be used in any situation or mode. The Breacher really comes into its own once you unlock access to C4. ==Abilites== : Normal *10% increased explosive radius for self and teammates within 20m. *Carry double the amount of grenades or C4. : Re-Enlist *15% increased explosive radius for self and teammates within 20m. *Carry triple amount of grenades and C4. *Damage Vital Points and HVTs more effectively with explosives. ==Head Kits== *[FUBAR] Machined *Overkill *Grinder *Cyclops ==Accesories== *[FUBAR] Explosives *Blast *Powder *Demoliton *Scout [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line class]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

[[File:Scavenger.jpg|thumb|334px]] The Scavenger is the Damneds answer to the Breacher. The Scavenger (and nearby teammates) enjoy a similar increased explosive radius as does the Breacher, but thats the extent of the similarities. Whereas the Breacher is designed to inflict greater explosive damage, the Scavenger is best-suited for withstanding explosive attacks and cleaning up after them. The Scavenger takes substantially less damage from explosivesenough to survive a single Frag Grenade or C4 explosion.
The Scavenger can also repair damaged Vital Points significantly faster than any other class, making it the ideal class to have on defense during games of Buried. The Scavenger really comes into its own after reenlisting. It retains the abilities of the Level 1 Class Bonus while gaining the ability to carry double the ammo and retrieve additional grenades and ammo from drops. Reenlisted Scavengers are excellent front-line attackers, capable of absorbing enemy Proximity Mines and clearing a path for teammates en route to the enemy base. ==Abilites== : Normal *10% increased explosive radius for self and teammates within 10m. *Scavenger takes 40% less damage from explosives. *Repair Vital Points 75% faster. : Re-Enlist *15% increased explosive radius for self and teammates within 20m. *Scavenger takes 80% less damage from explosives. *Gain extra ammo and grenades from ammo drops and carry double ammo. ==Head Kits== *[FUBAR] Grilled *Spade *Froggy ==Accessories== *[FUBAR] Trapper *Scavenger *Hunter *Extirminator *Forage [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line class]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

[[File:Exicution.jpg|thumb|A player about to execute another.]] Execution is an attack players can perform in Spec Ops: The Line. In singleplayer after meleeing or wounding an enemy the player can press the melee button again while standing over them to finish them off. This awards the player with a small amount of extra ammo for both of their weapons. In multiplayer this attack can be performed after incapacitating the opponent. ==Gallery== <gallery captionalign="left"> Execution.jpg Execution 2.jpg walker execution.jpg Execution 3.jpg </gallery> [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

{{Infobox |Box title = AH-6J Little Bird |image = Image:Scout Helicopter.jpg |Row 1 title = Appears in |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Used by |Row 2 info = [[33rd Infantry]] |Row 3 title = Weapons |Row 3 info = 2 Miniguns, LAU-68D/A pod with 7 2.75inch Hydra rockets, and Passengers gun}}The Scout helicopter is used by the 33rd Infantry to attack The Squad in the begining of the Spec Ops: The Line demo. =="Kabaul"== Do you mean Kabul? BravoWhiskeyNine.
Yup, just changed that [[User:.22-Shooter|.22-Shooter]] 17:14, June 14, 2012 (UTC)
== Sunstroke? ==
Did anyone else think walker was suffering from sunstroke? it would make sense [[Special:Contributions/94.169.233.237|94.169.233.237]] 12:04, August 12, 2012 (UTC)
With Dubai's heat, it's very possible, but I don't think heat stroke can make you hallucinate. It's also possible the white phosphorus/temperature fluctuations did something to his head, if you wanna think about that. You said WHAT? 13:25, August 12, 2012 (UTC)
Walkers been in the desert for days without food,water,or sleep so I can see how hes hullucinating.[[User:MyOpsAreBlackerThenYours|SWAGNETO]] 18:08, August 12, 2012 (UTC)

page.title: User blog:MyOpsAreBlackerThenYours/Nolan North on Spec Ops: The Line.

revision.comment: moved [[User blog:UK13/Nolan North on Spec Ops: The Line.]] to [[User blog:MyOpsAreBlackerThenYours/Nolan North on Spec Ops: The Line.]]: Automatically moved page while renaming the user "[[User:UK13|UK13]]" to "[[User:MyOpsAreBlackerThenYours|MyOpsA...
revision.text:
[http://www.xbox360achievements.org/news/news-11867-Nolan-North-Talks-Spec-Ops--The-Line--Kittens---Nolan-North--The-Video-Game.html xbox360achivements.org] sat down Nolan North the voice actor of Martin Walker about his experience with spec ops the line. To sum it up he said this about these topics:
Who is Martin Walker? Hes a great soldier, but he still is human. He also said The Line will be "one of the most psychologically mind-bending games" hes ever been involved with
Was Walker diffrent from what you ussauly do? Yes,I think what makes it different is that rather than the player walking in his shoes, youre walking in his mind. You feel for the character. The game hits at an emotional level that very few shooters will reach.
How dificult is it to switch from "killer" to "peacemaker"? You know, bi-polar disorder would probably help. Its not as drastic as Killer"or Peacemaker but there are definite levels of intensity that you can put yourself in emotionally. You want hear it vocally.
Did he get to improvise? Yes and the Writer did a good job with the story.
How important is it to be in the studios while acting? He prefers working in the studio. He also complamented our savvyness. How nice
How did he get into Walkers character? He watched military chanel and imagines what he would do in Walkers positon. 2K also gave him a descrption of Walker which said this: Hes like any soldier in the military. Hes a guy who probably would have had a normal life if he wasnt in the military. He could have worked in an office but the next thing you know hes in a uniform and hes shipped off somewhere and hes a military guy. Hes obviously Special Forces, hes at least a career military guy, and Ive known some people like that. But ultimately you just put as much of yourself that will fit in that character and you take it from there.
Everything else isnt involved with the game. So what do you think? [[Category:Blog posts]]

revision.text:
'''{{Infobox |Box title = Dubai |image = File:Dubai.png |caption = [[Captain Martin Walker|Captain Walker]] looking at the remains of post-sandstorm Dubai. |Row 1 title = Appears in |Row 1 info = ''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]'' |Row 2 title = Continent |Row 2 info = Asia |Row 3 title = Population |Row 3 info = 2,262,000}}'''
{{quote|In the first days there was no fear these are the last days. Fear is all we know.|Unknown Refugee on the fall of Dubai}}
'''Dubai''' is both an [[wikipedia:Emirate|emirate]] and a city within the [[wikipedia:United Arab Emirates|United Arab Emirates]] and the setting of ''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]''.
In ''Spec Ops: The Line'', a devastating [[wikipedia:Dust storm|sand storm]] hits Dubai, resulting in its cities being engulfed in sand and causing a massive death toll. The surviving citizens become [[Refugees|refugees]]. The [[33rd Infantry]] Regiment of the United States Army are ordered into Dubai by [[Colonel John Konrad]] in order to evacuate the population, but instead the regiment is caught in the sand storm and the evacuation ends in failure, resulting in the disappearance of Colonel Konrad and a civil war erupting between [[The Damned]], [[The Exiles]], and the [[Refugees]].
Six months later [[Captain Martin Walker]] and his team, consisting of himself, [[Lugo|Sergeant John Lugo]] and [[Adams|Lieutenant Alphanso Adams]], are sent into Dubai after the catastrophic sand storm in order to locate survivors and launch an evacuation operation. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Locations]]

[[Category:Videos]]Category: Music
Keywords: Disturbed, Sickness, Musik

[[File:FUBAR_Pack.jpg|thumb]] The FUBAR Pack is a DLC for those who pre-orderd Spec Ops: The Line and comes with these bonuses *Double XP for a week *AK-47 at Rank 1 *Officer Class at Rank 1 *Clan Accesories: Exclusive Skins/Accessories for all classes and Unique and Visually Distinct items. ==Kits== The Damned *Airlift-[[Gunner]] *Morgue-[[Officer]] *Iveler-[[Medic]] *Grilled-[[Scavenger]] *Specter-[[Sniper]] The Exiles *Gassed-[[Gunner]] *Warzone-[[Officer]] *Heneral Suergon-[[Medic]] *Machined-[[Breacher]] *Skunk-[[Sniper]] ==
Trivia== *FUBAR is military slang for "Fucked Up Beyond All Recogniton/Any Repair/All Reason" which can be said for Dubai in-game. ==Video== [[File:Spec Ops The Line - Multiplayer Gameplay Trailer|thumb|left|375px]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Spec Ops]]

[[File:US.jpg|thumb|239px|right|The US flag]] The '''United States of America''' (commonly abreviated US or USA) is a country in North America and most of the playable factions in the Spec Ops series belong to their armed forces, such as [[US Army Rangers|Rangers]], [[US Army Green Berets|Green Berets]], [[33rd Infantry]], and [[Delta Force]].
{{stub}} [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Stealth Patrol]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Covert Assault]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Spec Ops II: Green Berets]] [[Category:Spec Ops II: Omega Squad]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Ranger Elite]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Rangers Lead the Way]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Ranger Team Bravo]] [[Category:Locations]]

[[File:The line mp.jpg|thumb|300px|right]] In [[Spec Ops: The Line]] players have the choice of playing online multiplayer. Multiplayer is linked to the single player campaign. In multiplayer [[The Damned]] and [[The Exiles]] engage in combat. The gameplay's enviroment plays an important role, in the form of sand. Multiplayer uses a class system instead of a create-a-class one, with the four classes and one faction specific class: [[Officer]], [[Sniper]], [[Gunner]], [[Medic]], and [[Scavenger]] for The Damned or [[Breacher]] for the Exiles. ==Setting== Spec Ops: The Line's multiplayer is set before Walker and his squad were sent to Dubai, instead taking place during the inital war between "[[The Exiles]]" and "[[The Damned |The Damned" ]][[33rd Infantry]]
==Maps== ''NOTE: The list will change after maps are confirmed'' *Extinction *Dockside *Crow's Nest *Last Resort * * *
==Weapons== ''NOTE:The list may change after the release of the game'' *[[Scout Tactical]] *[[AK47|AK-47]] *[[Micro 9mm]] *[[W1300]] *[[AA-12]] *[[Browning M2A2]] *[[Milkor MGL Mk 1L]] *[[UMP 45|UMP-45]] *[[SCAR-H|FN SCAR-H]] *[[FAMAS]] *[[FN MK 13]] *[[RPG-7]] *[[P90]] *[[MSG-90]] *[[Colt Python]] *[[Vector SMG]] *[[FN MK 13]] *M110 *AK-74 *MP7 *M1014 *OTS-14 *[[M249 SAW]] *G18 *M-99 *P220 *FNP-45 *[[Desert Eagle]] *[[M2E2HMG]] *417
==Sand== Sand plays a large part in gameplay. Players can throw a grenade at the ground and the sand will kick up into opponent's faces or shoot at certain points until they are destroyed and sand buries any player unlucky enough to be in the radius of it. Also at least one sandstorm happens during gameplay. ==Movement== In gameplay players can walk, run, vault, and take cover. You walk by moving the left analong stick by default, running is activated by pressing X for PS3 and move the left stick and after the player starts running they no longer need to hold X, vaulting is caused by pressing (circle) when near objects like barricades, and taking cover is caused by tapping (X) when near objects like a wall. Holding (X) will cause you to get into the nearest cover as you sprint. ==Combat== There are two ways of killing opponets with guns or with a melee. From gameplay shown, it's not hard to get killed. After a player goes down any player from the opposing team has the choice to [[Execution|execute]] the victim before he can be revived, but the victim can bleed out instead of allowing the opponet to execute him or a teamate can rescue the player and continue fighting.
==Game Modes== ''NOTE:The list may change at a later point in time.'' *Classic Deathmatch *Team Deathmatch *Rally Point *Burried ==Trivia== *The Original name of the teams were Konrad and Spec Ops [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

{{Infobox |Box title = Agent Daniels |image = Image:Dead Daniels.jpg |caption = Walker looking at a dead Daniels. |Row 1 title = Title |Row 1 info = Agent |Row 2 title = Gender |Row 2 info = Male |Row 3 title = Faction |Row 3 info =
US,CIA,Grey Fox
|Row 4 title = Status |Row 4 info = K.I.A. |Row 5 title = Appears in |Row 5 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 6 title = Period |Row 6 info = 21st Century |Row 7 title = Voiced by |Row 7 info = Rick Pasqualone}}Agent Thomas Daniels is an [[United States|American]] CIA Agent in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. Daniels led a team into [[Dubai]] to look for survivors but was captured by the [[33rd Infantry]]. The [[Radio DJ]] broadcasts the torture of Daniels. When Daniels is found by [[Captain Martin Walker|Walker]] and his team, it is revealed he was killed a long time ago and hung upside down with a tape of his torture in his mouth which was a trap intended for Agent Gould. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line characters]] [[Category:Spec Ops]] [[Category:CIA]]

[[File:Sandstorm.jpg|thumb|275px|right|A sandstorm in The Line.]] Sandstorms play a large part in both the single player and multiplayer of Spec Ops: The Line. When a sandtorm happens the players line of sight is blocked and the character covers their eyes. The effects of sandstorms can be stopped by either going inside or using the perk adaptive(the perk lessens the effects). It is also said that at least one sandstorm happens each match except on the map Extinction. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

{{Infobox |Box title = Emirati Refugees |image = Image:The Line Refugee.jpg |caption = Refugee meleed by Walker |Row 1 title = Appears in |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Interactions |Row 2 info = Hostile(Friendly later) |Row 3 title = Led by |Row 3 info = Grey Fox, [[CIA]]|Row 4 title = Country |Row 4 info = [[Dubai]]}}The '''Emirati Refugees''' are a group of survivors of the [[Dubai]] sandstorm led by a [[CIA]] squad. Before [[Delta Force|Delta Squad]] arrived in Dubai, the 33rd and Refugees had a cease fire agreement, but the refugees later called off the cease fire. At first they were hostile to both the [[33rd Infantry]] and [[Captain Martin Walker|Walker's]] team, but after it was confirmed that Walker's squad were also against the 33rd they became freindly. The CIA squad used them as a distraction.
==Equipment== *[[AK47]] *[[Micro 9mm]] *[[W1300]] *[[M9]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Faction]] [[Category:CIA]] [[Category:Freindlies in Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line enemy]]

[[File:Zipline.jpg|thumb|203px|Walker using a zipline.]]Ziplines are a type of environmental equipment that appear in Spec Ops: The Line's single and multiplayer campaigns. They are left around levels and maps so players can faster or more easily access their destinations. In single player mode, they are not limited solely to the Delta soldiers, and can be used by enemies. Shooting 10 enemies off of ziplines will reward the player with the [[Airspace Control]] [[Spec Ops: The Line/Achievements|achievement]]. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]]

{{Infobox |Box title = M120 Mortar |image = Image:The Line Unkown Mortar.jpg |Row 1 title = Appears In |Row 1 info = Spec Ops: The Line |Row 2 title = Type |Row 2 info = Launcher|Row 3 title = Capacity |Row 3 info = 1}}The '''M120 Mortar''' is a mortar that appears in [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. It is the largest caliber weapon to appear in the game.
The M120 is encountered by [[Martin Walker|Walker]], [[Adams]] and [[Lugo]] as they stealthily approach The Gate guarding the entrance to [[33rd Infantry|33rd]] controlled territory. After Adams dispatches a single guard, Walker orders his team to set up the mortar and fire it upon the 33rd outpost. Lugo objects, noting that the mortar rounds contain white phosorous, which the team has already encountered the grisly effects of. Walker, however, claims the team have no choice and uses it nonetheless. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Weapons of Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Launcher]]

{{Infobox |Box title = P90 |image = Image:the line p90.jpg |Row 1 title = Appears In |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Type |Row 2 info = Submachine Gun |Row 3 title = Magazine size |Row 3 info = 50|Row 4 title = Special ability |Row 4 info = Laser Pointer |Row 5 title = Used by |Row 5 info = [[Zulu Squad]]}}The '''P90''' is a submachine gun that appears in [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. The gun makes its first appearance in the chapter Riggs being used by Zulu Squad. The only way to use the P90 in its singleplayer is to pick it up from a Zulu Squad member. ==Gallery== <gallery captionalign="left"> the line screen.jpg|The P90 being fired by a medic </gallery> [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Weapons of Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Submachine Guns]]

{{Infobox |Box title = Colt Python |image = Image:SOTL44Mag.jpg |Row 1 title = Appears in |Row 1 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 2 title = Type |Row 2 info = Revolver |Row 3 title = Capacity |Row 3 info = 6}}The '''.44 Magnum''' is a revolver that appears in [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. It makes very limited apperances in the singleplayer campaign, and is first shown being used by CIA Agent Riggs. The .44 Magnum is one of the most powerful handguns in the game, along with the [[Desert Eagle]].
[[Martin Walker|Walker]] obtains the .44 Magnum in the singleplayer campaign at the start of Chapter 11. Walker picks up a .44 Magnum lying next to [[Agent Riggs|Riggs]], which only has 1 round in it. The player can use it to kill Riggs. This is the only time that the .44 Magnum is obtainable by the player in the campaign. [[Category:Weapons]] [[Category:Weapons of Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Handguns]]

[[File:Placeholder|right|300px]] Agent Riggs is part of the CIA with Agent Gould, Castavin, and Daniels who are dead. When you go to rescue him he tells you about a plan to steal water from the 33rd, but once his plan goes wrong he purposely crashes the trucks. You can choose to let him be burned alive or kill him with the magnum. He wanted the water from the Aquatic Colosseum and drain it to Dubai [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line characters]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:CIA]] [[Category:Freindlies in Spec Ops: The Line]]

{{Infobox |Box title = Agent Castavin |image = Image:Unknown caracther.jpg |caption = Castavin about be killed by McPhereson |Row 1 title = Gender |Row 1 info = Male |Row 2 title = Faction |Row 2 info = U.S. CIA |Row 3 title = Status |Row 3 info = KIA |Row 4 title = Appears in |Row 4 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 5 title = Period |Row 5 info = 21st Century}}Brian Castavin was one of the leaders of the refugees alongside his fellow agents Gould, Riggs, and Daniels. He is seen in the hotel talking to a member of the refugees telling the refugee that the building could have fell apart on them because of their use of C4 he then asks him about the 33rd prisoner, Lt.McPherson, and soon begins to interrogate him. After Walker and his squad appear Castavin get distracted by their sudden apperance and is killed by McPherson with his own M9. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line characters]] [[Category:CIA]]

[[File:MFWICAchievement.jpg|right]]To get the MFWIC achievement in [[Spec Ops: The Line]], beat the game on the "FUBAR" difficulty setting. ==Trivia== *MFWIC is slang for "Mother Fucker Who's In Charge" or "Military Figure Who's In Charge" [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:TheDevilsDiscipleAchievement.jpg|right]]The Devil's Disciple is an achievement for the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn the achievement, you must beat the game on the "Suicide Mission" difficulty. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:WeWereSoldiersAchievement.jpg|right]]We Were Soldiers is an achievement for the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must beat the game on "Combat Op" difficulty. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:Healing.jpg|frame|Walker healing Lugo]] Healing is an ability that can be done in all Spec Ops games with most of them using the medkit to heal themselves or there teammate. But in Spec Ops: The Line healing is diffrent because of the introduction of regenerative health. Instead of being healed after taking damage you get healed after being downed. In single player if one of Walkers' squad goes down a bar with their name on it showing how much longer they have until they bleed out will appear. The player can either tell the other squadmate to go heal him or heal the squadmate theirself. In multiplayer healing works almost the exact same way as in single player but now you can call for help or choose to bleed out. But if no one comes to heal you in time and a enemy player sees you, the player may execute you. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line multiplayer]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Covert Assault]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Stealth Patrol]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Ranger Elite]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Rangers Lead the Way]] [[Category:Spec Ops: Airborne Commando]] [[Category:Spec Ops:Ranger Team Bravo]] [[Category:Spec Ops II: Green Berets]] [[Category:Spec Ops]]

[[File:1stchoice.jpg|thumb|195px|The soldier and civilian]] After Walker finds a radio and it is revealed that Konrad is alive and still
[[File:SoldierCivilianChoice.jpg|thumb|202px|the two convicted.]]leading the 33rd after he contacts them on the radio the squad finds their way outside with a soldier and a civilian tied up on a sign with their mouths taped and snipers aimed at them. Konrad once again contacts Walker telling him that the civilian stole water (an extreme crime) and the soldier was sent to apprehend him but killed the civilian's family in the process and because of both of them 5 people are dead and Konrad wants Walker to choose who dies and who lives. If the player tries to run away he will get gunned down by the snipers, if the player attacks the snipers the snipers quickly dispatch Walker. If the player chooses the soldier to live Walker's squad will say they need to hurry and leave. If the player chooses the civilian the squad will be angered that Walker allowed a fellow soldier to die.
==Trivia== *If the player shoots one of the convicted's ropes the freed one will try and run away but is killed by one of the groups of snipers and the convict that's still tied up will be killed by the other group. *Killing the civilian or soldier will give you the [[Damned if You Do]] achievement. *You shoot at the snipers to get the [[Damned if You Don't |Damned if You Don't]] achievement.

[[File:BootAchievement.jpg|right]]Boot is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn it, you must beat the game on the "Walk on the Beach" difficulty setting. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:MarksmanGrenadeAchievement.jpg|right]]The Marksman - Grenade achievement is an achievement in [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn it, you must make 50 kills with grenades. Only kills during the single-player campaign count towards this achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:MarksmanHeavyArmsAchievement.jpg|right]]The Marksman - Heavy Arms achievement is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this, you must make 150 kills with heavy weapons. Only kills during the single-player campaign count towards this achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:MarksmanSniperAchievement.jpg|right]]The Marksman - Sniper achievement is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this, you must make 50 kills with sniper rifles. Only kills during the single-player campaign count towards this achievement. [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]]

[[File:TheRoadBackAchievement.jpg|thumb]]After you have completed the chapter "Welcome" a cutscene will begin and it will show soldiers aproaching an armed Walker. To get this achivment you must give them your weapon and allow them to take you back to the US. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:MarksmanShotgunAchievement.jpg|right]]The Marksman - Shotgun achievement is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this, you must make 75 kills with shotguns. Only kills during the single-player campaign count towards this achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:MarksmanSmallArmsAchievement.jpg|right]]The Marksman - Small Arms achievement is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this, you must make 100 kills with pistols and SMGs. Only kills during the single-player campaign count towards this achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:MarksmanRifleAchievement.jpg|right]]The Marksman - Rifle achievement is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this, you must make 350 kills with rifles. Only kills during the single-player campaign count towards this achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:AimHighAchievement.jpg|right]]The Aim High achievement is from the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this, you must kill 250 enemies with head shots. Only kills in the single-player campaign count towards this achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:AppliedForceAchievement.jpg|right]]Applied Force is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn it, you must hit 10 enemies with your melee attack. Only melee attacks in the single-player campaign mode count towards this achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:InYourFaceAchievement.jpg|right]]In Your Face is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must vault over a barrier while kicking an enemy in the face. This must be in the single-player campaign for it to count. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:BlindLuckAchievement.jpg|right]]Blind Luck is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must make 5 kills while blind firing. Only kills in the single-player campaign count towards this achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

revision.comment: Created page with "[[File:TheRoadToGloryAchievement.jpg|thumb]]In the epilouge soldiers sent to rescue the Delta team will approach an [[AA-12|armed]] [[Martin Walker|Walker]]. The player will have..."
revision.text: [[File:TheRoadToGloryAchievement.jpg|thumb]]In the epilouge soldiers sent to rescue the Delta team will approach an [[AA-12|armed]] [[Martin Walker|Walker]]. The player will have the choice to drop the weapon or fire at the soldiers. If the player chooses to fire and get killed they will get this achivement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:GoodTrainingAchievement.jpg|right]]Good Training is an achievement from the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To get this achievement, you must sprint into cover 10 times while being shot at by enemies. This only applies to the single-player campaign. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:UnfriendlyFireAchievement.jpg|thumb]]In Chapter 10, Part 2 you will find a trapped Agent Riggs under one of the burning trucks. After a cutscene he will give you his .44 Magnum and beg Walker to kill him and put him out of his misery. To get this trophy you don't kill Riggs and you let him burn. [[File:SituationalAwarenessAchievement.jpg|right]]Situational Awareness is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must stun an enemy by dumping sand on their head. You can only earn this achievement in the single-player campaign. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:AdaptAndOvercomeAchievement.jpg|right]]Adapt and Overcome is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must kill 10 enemies by blowing up explosive items on the battlefield. These kills must be in the single-player campaign to count. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:BattleManagementAchievement.jpg|right]]Battle Management is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must make 50 kills by using the Attack Command. Only kills in the single-player campaign count towards this. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:CloseCombatCarnageAchievement.jpg|right]]Close Combat Carnage is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must make 4 kills with a shotgun in under 10 seconds. This only counts if you are in the single-player campaign. [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]]

[[File:AirspaceControlAchievement.jpg|right]]Airspace Control is an achievement for the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must make 10 kills while enemies are using zip lines or rappelling. This can only be earned in the single-player campaign. [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]]

[[File:DamnCloseAchievement.jpg|right]]Damn Close is an achievement for the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must kill an Edged Weapon Expert from up to 5 meters away. This can only be earned on the single-player campaign. ==Trivia== *When you are about to get this trophy Walker will say "Damn close" and the achievment will appear. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:PreventativeDiplomacyAchievement.jpg|right]]Preventative Diplomacy is an achievement for the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must kill an enemy just before they throw a grenade. This will only count in the single-player campaign. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:SierraHotelAchievement.jpg|right]]Sierra Hotel is an achievement from [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must make it through three chapters of the single-player campaign without dying or restarting. [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]]

[[File:AllYouCanBeAchievement.jpg|right]]All You Can Be is an achievement from the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must beat a chapter in the single-player campaign without dying or restarting and have a 60% or better accuracy. [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]]

[[File:DeerHunterAchievement.jpg|right]]Deer Hunter is an achievement in the game ''[[Spec Ops: The Line]]''. To earn this achievement, you must kill an [[wikipedia:Oryx|Oryx]] in the single-player campaign. The easiest location for this is right at the beginning of the game; after rappelling down your first rope, look to the right of the path for some antelopes to hunt. Shoot one quickly before they run away. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:ReconAchievement.jpg|right]]Recon is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must find at least 12 Intel drops in the single-player campaign. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:IntelOperativeAchievement.jpg|right]]Intel Operative is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must find all of the intel drops in the single-player campaign. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:ArmyOfOneAchievement.jpg|right]]Army of One is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must kill at least three enemies with a single grenade. Only kills in the single-player campaign count for this achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:SpotterAchievement.jpg|right]]Spotter is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must find at least one Intel drop in the single-player campaign. [[Category:Achievements]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]]
[[File:TheyLiveAchievement.jpg|right]]They Live is an achievement in the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:TheHumanFactorAchievement.jpg|right]]The Human Factor is an achievement from the game [[Spec Ops: The Line]]. To earn this achievement, you must tag an enemy with a sticky grenade. This will only count in the single-player campaign. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Forumheader|Watercooler}} ***************WARNING - CONTAINS SPOILERS************* So guys, if someone can help me answer this Who was that bald guy with the blind eye? he's only on the mind of Walker too? *Hes a real 33rd soldier that Walker interrogated. The bald guy i'm referring is that guy who asks Walker whats the new mission if u "kill" Konrad on the end *He was a hullucination all the soldiers in the chapter welcome are hullucinations. If Konrad was already dead and the radio man too, who was giving orders to that battalion who killed Adams when he pushed Walker down that bunker? *Probably the remaining officers in the 33rd. Colonel Konrad and his battalion was damned because the death of the civilians they tried to evacuate right? *That was probably just a nickname they got from some war. and the CIA was trying to do what? *They were either trying to get rid of the 33rd or find Konrad So, the mission of the CIA was to kill all the 33rd and hide the deaths of civilians from the world? and killing everyone theres no one to tell the history? *Pretty much,since before Riggs died he said that if UAE found out what happened in Dubai they would declare war on the US and the US wouldn't win. What purpose Riggs wanted to destroy the water ? *So the 33rd would die of thirst he said something about not letting the world know, but know what? *About the death of civilians and etc. he was trying to hide from the world the operation that the 33rd did but ended in failure? *Dubai said they didn't need help so the 33rd or anyone else weren't legally allowed to be there and the sandstorm hit the 33rd and the civilians before they were evacuated. why the CIA was fighting with the battalion? *There mission was to kill all the 33rd soldiers what was they primary objective? *Konrad and 33rd-Evacuate Dubai *CIA-Kill the rouge 33rd *Delta Squad-Look for survivors After Walker and his team kills the civilians with the white phosphorus, is in that moment that he go mad? Because he say something about make the 33rd pay, so he was already blaming Konrad? *Yes, and he blamed Konrad a lot before the WP thing and he said something about that attack was forced by someone, but who was this someone? *I believe the 33rd. Theres another moment when Walker do a zip-line and "kills" Adams, but in reality he was killing an enemy, whys that? was he angry with Adams ? *He was just having a hallucination But is there an specific motive to this hallucination? *Adams was mad at him alot during the game. and does Walker blames himself for the death of Lugo? because he imagine the enemy just like Lugo? that armed man with the .50 *At first he blamed Konrad but later he blames himself In the end when hes in that hummer with the soldiers, and the soldiers ask him how he survived, and he replies that he don't, whats the meaning of that? was that he was another "man", just like the bad end of Manhunt 2? *Its more like he was physically alive but mentally dead. That scene when we are shooting on the others helicopters, and Walker says that he thinks that he already seen that scene, what did he mean by that? any theory? In the prolouge the did the Blackhawk part already then they had to re-do it the exact same way so Walker broke the 4th wall and mentioned it.. sorry, but what is the 4th wall? but why they had to re-do it exact the same way? and why Walker thinks that event already hapened? because if we are re-doing the history per say, so its like we are seeing walker telling the history right?, The 4th wall is what seperates the caracthers from the people watchin or playing so if a caracther was to say "hey player stop eating your pizza bagels and help me not get beat by wallking trashcan" the caracther broke the 4th Wall. He was remembering what happend and since the blackhawk crashing was the reason Walker was remembering and imagining those things he probably rememberd he was already in the Blackhawk. thanks for your patience , more questions to come ==Storyline== So basically the storyline is like this: *Dubai got hit by Sandstorm *[[33rd Infantry|Damned 33rd]] sent in to evacuate civilians, result: failed (civilians got killed) *CIA sent in to cover U.S. mistakes from the world *33rd choose to stay to protect water? why?
Or to maintain control to help civilians survive from the sandstorm? *Delta sent in to rescue 33rd (original mission) *[[Martin Walker|Walker]] tricked by CIA than blame his own mistakes to [[Colonel John Konrad|Konrad]] that cause hallucination. Is it right? What do you think guys? *Yes *Yes *Yes *They chose to maintain control which didn't turn out well *Delta was sent to find survivors,radio command,and leave *Pretty Much BTW the story is looks similar with COD:BlackOps
[[User:BioBrain|BioBrain]] 14:24, July 3, 2012 (UTC)

[[File:Untitled47.png|thumb|380px|right|Zulu Squad members exiting a Blackhawk.]] Zulu Squad was the 33rd Infantry's elite fighting force. They were first seen in Chapter 10 when [[Agent Riggs|Riggs]] was picking the door's lock. After that, they continue to appear multiple times. They can easily be distinguished by their black and orange armour and black and white helmet. Their presence can be detected by listening to their audible radio conversations. They are always equipped with either a [[P90]] or [[SCAR-H]] and take more damage then normal [[33rd Infantry|33rd soldiers]], due at least in part to their additional armor. [[Category:33rd Infantry]]

revision.comment: Created page with "Hey just because something is popular doesn't make it a good thing. I've loved the CoD series up until Modern Warfare 2, then I decided they were just milking the series, and pul..."
revision.text: Hey just because something is popular doesn't make it a good thing. I've loved the CoD series up until Modern Warfare 2, then I decided they were just milking the series, and pulling plots out of their asses. However, Spec Ops: The Line deliveres a very very unique experience story-wise. I wish there could have been a bit more of devolepment on the men in the 33rd, a longer story, the city when the first storms hit and a bit more exploration; yet I loved the game as a whole. Spec Ops: The Line is emotional, with real decisions and real choices that you have to make in real time, with no clear "right or wrong" options. You chose in the heat of the moment and that impacts what happens to characters and the story. You don't get that with CoD. The multiplayer could be a bit better, but I'm not complaining. I actually just beat the story, and I love it. It's definetley worth the money, the time and the experience.

[[File:TheHorrorAchievement.jpg|thumb]]Towards the end of Chapter 6 you'll reach a set of stairs where a dead Daniels is hanging upside down. Once the cutscene starts, you'll get the achievement. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

[[File:DamnedIfYouDontAchievement.jpg|thumb]]In chapter 9 Konrad forces Walker to either [[Soldier or Civilian Choice|kill a soldier or civilian]]. To get this trophy you fire at the snipers instead of killing them. [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Achievements]]

{{Infobox |Box title = Agent Gould |image = Image:Gould.jpg |Row 1 title = Title |Row 1 info = Agent |Row 2 title = Gender |Row 2 info = Male |Row 3 title = Faction |Row 3 info = US,CIA,Grey Fox |Row 4 title = Status |Row 4 info = K.I.A. |Row 5 title = Appears in |Row 5 info = [[Spec Ops: The Line]] |Row 6 title = Period |Row 6 info = 21st Century |Row 7 title = Voiced by |Row 7 info = Chris Cox}}Agent Rick Gould is a CIA agent and a member of [[Grey Fox]], a team sent into [[Dubai]] to look for survivors. He is one the leaders of the [[refugees]] alongside other Grey Fox agents [[Agent Daniels|Daniels]], [[Agent Castavin|Castavin]], and [[Agent Riggs|Riggs]]. He is first seen rescuing [[Martin Walker|Walker's]] team from a trap set by the 33rd which was set up for him. He is later seen leading an attack on The Gate, which fails and is captured by the [[33rd Infantry|33rd]] and interrogated for information about Agent Riggs. Delta can choose to rescue Gould or the civilians that are going to be executed. If Delta tries to save Gould, a firefight ensures and after the battle is over Gould dies from the sand used in his torture. If [[Delta Force|Delta]] chooses to save the civilians, Gould is strangled by the interrogator. [[Category:Characters]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line]] [[Category:Spec Ops: The Line characters]] [[Category:CIA]] [[Category:Freindlies in Spec Ops: The Line]]

[[File:StudioRobot.jpg|thumb|174px]]
Hey there, I'm Chris, aka SilenceInTheLibrary, nice to meet you! I've been on Spec Ops Wiki a while, and I'm learning as much as I can and I hope to have the game very soon.
I joined this wiki because I happened upon it randomly at the "Other Wikis" part of any given page, and thought, hey, why not? I saw that the wiki was focusing on a reboot that made it essentially new. So I decided to chip in and help.
You can find me here or at Silent Hill Wiki any day of the week.
Two game series I hold in my heart are Metroid and Zelda, although, I'm not on either of those wikis, frankly because they're just too big and my kind of input would likely get me rejected.
Hmm, what can I tell you about myself? Let's see, I love WWE, I've read at a college grade level since I was eight, and I want to be a graphic designer for the hottest video games in a few years.
If you mention Call of Duty or Halo around me, as well as Skyrim on occasion, I will stuff my fingers in my ears and loudly go "La la, lala la la, lala lala la la!" until I think you're done. I'm a big fan of Nintendo classics, too.
Feel free at any time to meet my extended family on Silent Hill Wiki! Or talk to me anywhere, it doesn't matter.
I'm currently writing the walkthrough for Spec Ops: The Line, and many thanks to [[User:Pvt sleepy|Frank]] for writing the 4th chapter for me!
That's all for now. I'll obsessively add more to my profile later. See you around!
